Bookshelf

A selection of books from my bookshelf that have helped shape my perspectives on design, the way I work and the way I see the world.

  • Imaginary Cities Darran Anderson

  • It's Not How Good You Are It's How Good You Want to Be Paul Arden

  • Whatever You Think, Think the Opposite Paul Arden

  • Meditations Marcus Aurelius

  • Adventures in Numberland Alex Bellos

  • Can You Solve My Problems? Alex Bellos

  • This Will Make You Smarter John Brockman

  • Do Story Bobette Buster

  • Invisible Cities Italo Calvino

  • Creativity Inc. Ed Catmull

  • The Shape of Design Frank Chimero

  • Influence Robert B. Cialdini

  • The Alchemist Paulo Coelho

  • Daily Rituals: How Artists Work Mason Currey

  • Tools of Titans Tim Ferriss

  • Atlas Obscura Joshua Foer

  • The Elements of Eloquence Mark Forsyth

  • Outliers Malcolm Gladwell

  • The 48 Laws of Power Robert Greene

  • 50 Things That Made the Modern Economy Tim Harford

  • The Undercover Economist Tim Harford

  • Sapiens Yuval Noah Harrari

  • Homo Deus Yuval Noah Harrari

  • Do Purpose David Hieatt

  • The Daily Stoic Ryan Holiday

  • Brave New World Aldous Huxley

  • The Innovators Walter Isaacson

  • Steve Jobs Walter Isaacson

  • Thinking, Fast and Slow Daniel Kahneman

  • The Dharma Bums Jack Kerouac

  • On the Road Jack Kerouac

  • Steal Like an Artist Austin Kleon

  • Freakonomics Steven D. Levitt & Stephen J. Dubner

  • Think Like a Freak Steven D. Levitt & Stephen J. Dubner

  • The Crossroads of Should and Must Elle Luna

  • Einstein's Dreams Alan Lightman

  • The Design of Business Roger Martin

  • What If? Randall Munroe

  • Animal Farm George Orwell

  • Nineteen Eighty-Four George Orwell

  • 12 Rules for Life: An Antidote to Chaos Jordan B. Peterson

  • Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance Robert Pirsig

  • The War of Art Steven Pressfield

  • Gravity's Rainbow Thomas Pyncheon

  • The Elephant in the Brain Kevin Simler & Robin Hanson

  • The Little Book of Big Ideas - 150 Concepts and Breakthroughs that Transformed History Daniel Smith

  • The Black Swan Nassim Nicholas Taleb

  • Zero to One Peter Theil

  • The Art of War Sun Tzu

  • Elon Musk Ashlee Vance

About

I am currently Director of Design at Dawson Andrews and in the process of building the Research and Development part of the company. We'll explore interesting things like purpose, meaning and truth through technology. Let's talk.
